intro: Zyrphelis ecklonis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, hairy leaves and has a compact growth habit. Zyrphelis ecklonis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
